mods.abstract: Medals such as these were worn by members of the Rex court. This one is found among the papers of Captain Thomas P. Leathers, a New Orleans steamboat master and owner. The Rex Organization was founded in 1872 in an effort to entertain Russia's Grand Duke Romanoff during his visit to the city, to attract visitors to New Orleans, and to provide a daytime parade as an alternative to the rowdy processions that had come to characterize Mardi Gras celebrations. The following year, it began the tradition of holding a ball and selecting a Queen of Carnival. Rex continues; its parade is held on Mardi Gras day.

titleInfo.title: Mardi Gras Mambo: Selections from LSU Libraries Special Collections

mods.accessCondition: Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright of the original material is retained in accordance with U.S. copyright laws. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Division, Louisiana State University Libraries.
Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.
mods.note: Thomas P. Leathers Family Papers, Mss. 1548, Louisiana and Lower Mississippi Valley Collections, LSU Libraries, Baton Rouge, Louisiana

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Transformed into MODS from extended Dublin Core by the LDL Development Team at Louisiana State University.
